page.title: 10ULLEY VILLAGE
page.content: { Ulley is a tiny village in South Yorkshire.Not many people live there because it is surrounded by fields.Two farms can be found in Ulley itself.One is called West End Farm and the other is Ulley Hall Farm.West End farm is a mixed farm with cows and cereal crops. Ulley Hall farm is an arable farm. These farms are a few hundred metres apart on either edge of the village.The village has a church that is used quite often but has a very small congregation.The bus service is not very frequent:three buses,four days a week Monday,Wednesday,Friday and Saturday. A small Post Office can be found on the main street and nearby is The Royal Oak Public House where refreshment and meals can be obtained.
